subject: Tennis
College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Virginia’s Somdev Devvarman became only the fourth player in the last 50 years to win consecutive N.C.A.A. men’s singles championships Monday by beating the Tennessee freshman J. P. Smith, 6-3, 6-2. Devvarman won the match in 61 minutes, joining Georgia’s Matias Boeker (2001-2) and Mikael Pernfors (1984-85), and Southern California’s Dennis Ralston (1963-64) as the only repeat champions in the past half-century.
